other_tests.findings: Left temporal and left central slow wave activity suggestive of localized cortical injury and rare left temporal interictal epileptiform discharges suggestive of an area of cortical irritability.
Captured a seizure at onset, showing low-voltage fast and ultrafast activity over the left anterior-mesial-frontal region.

Captured multiple seizures showing bicentral high-amplitude spike and wave discharge, followed by bicentral attenuation of EEG activity and then higher-amplitude rhythmic activity associated with the clinical behavior.
Found mild diffuse cerebellar atrophy and a slightly enlarged right temporal horn.
Slight decreases in N-acetylaspartate concentrations in the left mesial temporal region, suggestive of loss of neuronal elements.
Decreased right temporal lobe use of fluorodeoxyglucose, suggestive of decreased metabolic activity.
Seizure onset localized to the more posterior aspects of the supplementary motor cortex region on the left.
